agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Human Services TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, March 26, 2019 PLACE: E2.030 CHAIR: Rep. James B. Frank The order in which bills are heard is at the discretion of the chair. Public testimony may be limited to three (3) minutes. HB 251 Farrar Relating to the exclusion of certain resources in determining eligibility for the supplemental nutrition assistance program. HB 767 Davis, Sarah Relating to the evaluation of and reporting on certain Medicaid waiver projects. HB 988 Walle Relating to employee caseload limit goals for child and adult protective services and child-care licensing services and call processing goals for certain of those services. HB 1080 White Relating to prior authorization procedures for physical therapy services in Medicaid and the child health plan program. HB 1362 Wu Relating to the caseloads of child protective services caseworkers. HB 1536 Miller | et al. Relating to trauma-informed care for children in the conservatorship of the Department of Family and Protective Services, trauma-informed care training for certain department employees, and the establishment of the Trauma-Informed Care Task Force. HB 2091 Ortega Relating to the use of promotoras and community health workers in Medicaid managed care. HB 2221 Raymond | et al. Relating to a single Internet portal through which Medicaid providers may submit and receive information. HB 2285 Davis, Sarah Relating to administrative penalties assessed against certain nursing facilities for the improper discharge or transfer of a resident. HB 2363 Harris Relating to possession of firearms and ammunition in certain foster homes. HB 2368 Miller Relating to access to and the provision of behavioral and mental health care services and trauma-informed care in the Medicaid managed care program. HB 2490 Wu Relating to the system for maintaining records relating to children in the conservatorship of the Department of Family and Protective Services. HB 3079 Noble Relating to the authority to investigate abuse, neglect, or exploitation of children and adults in a residential or inpatient hospice facility. HB 3193 Hinojosa Relating to the licensing and regulation of a home and community support services agency. HB 3950 Frank Relating to the establishment of the child welfare task force and provision of services in the child welfare system. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
